intro: Acrosanthes fistulosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acrosanthes, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in open woodlands or shrublands. The plant produces striking, pale yellow or cream-colored flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often appearing in pairs along the stems. Acrosanthes fistulosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
